description:
Assess colony size at selected unmanaged piscivorous waterbird colonies in the Columbia River estuary to estimate per-capita predation rates by double-crested cormorants nesting on the Astoria-Megler Bridge

We will conduct several boat-based surveys (May- July) to estimate the size of the double-crested cormorant colony on the Astoria-Megler Bridge in 2021; this colony is currently the largest for the species throughout the Pacific Flyway of North America. This will allow us to estimate the per-capita smolt predation rates of double-crested cormorants nesting at the Bridge colony. This new analysis will provide resource managers with the information needed to adaptively manage current plans to reduce double-crested cormorant predation on juvenile salmonids in the CRE.
title: Astoria Cormorant Piscivorous Waterbird Colony Assessment  - Oregon State University
